intro: Aphanocalyx, commonly known as the white-flowered acanthus, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences that resemble those of the genus Acanthus. The flowers are typically small and white or pale in color, arranged in dense, spires. Aphanocalyx species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly China and Southeast Asia. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are used in traditional medicine in some regions.
